intro: Onosma tricerosperma var. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish thimbleweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
